alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 10:59AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Seneca, Wyandot and southeastern Hancock Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1059 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vanlue, or 11 miles west of Upper Sandusky, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Upper Sandusky, Forest, Sycamore, Vanlue, New Riegel, Carey, Nevada, Mount Blanchard, Wharton and Kirby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
